top_anomalies.title: The build-out of AI infrastructure is costing a fortune, straining companies and capital markets, writes the WSJ's Greg Ip
top_anomalies.snippet: The build-out of artificial-intelligence infrastructure is costing a fortune, straining companies and capital markets.

top_anomalies.title: Consumer Sentiment Still Broadly Negative Despite Small Improvements in July
top_anomalies.snippet: The mood of consumers improved for a second consecutive month in July, though it remains worse than it was in December, according to the latest installment of the University of Michigan's Surveys of Consumers, released Friday (Aug. 1). The rise in July from June was measured at 1.6%, stepping up to 61.7 from 60.

top_anomalies.title: Benzinga's 'Stock Whisper' Index: 5 Stocks Investors Secretly Monitor But Don't Talk About Yet
top_anomalies.snippet: Each week, Benzinga's Stock Whisper Index uses a combination of proprietary data and pattern recognition to showcase five stocks that are just under the surface and deserve attention.

top_anomalies.title: Trump's working group on digital asset markets looks to secure a win for his presidency
top_anomalies.snippet: Executive Director of the President's Council of Advisers on Digital Assets of the White House Bo Hines on the administration working to usher in the 'golden age' for digital assets.

top_anomalies.title: The Federal Reserve Isn't What Pundits Want It To Be, And Never Was
top_anomalies.snippet: The Fed's mandates are rooted in endless fallacy, most prominently the discredited Phillips Curve which says economic growth causes prices to rise. Please keep this in mind as monetary policy grandees pen high-toned pieces musing about what the next Fed Chairman should think about, and do.

top_anomalies.title: How Tariffs Raise Costs for Farmers, Making Food More Expensive
top_anomalies.snippet: The latest round of tariffs is likely to make agricultural production even more expensive and, potentially, limit access to goods not produced in the United States.

top_anomalies.title: Key ETF Asset Class Performance
top_anomalies.snippet: The market ended the month of July on a down note, but the S&P 500 still ended the month with a gain of 2.3%. While domestic equities posted small gains in July, there was quite a bit of disparity among international markets.

top_anomalies.title: It's a Scorching Hot Summer for Deals on Wall Street. Vacation Can Wait.

top_anomalies.title: Trade Fueled Inequality. Can Trump's Tariffs Reduce It?
top_anomalies.snippet: The president has pitched his trade policies at workers who feel left behind by globalization. But that doesn't mean trade barriers will revive factories and close income gaps.
